apache.description: The php-based implementation runs on an apache web server.
apache.title: Apache

delivery.description: The implementation includes a PHP-based webservice that can be easily deployed on an Apache webserver.

access.manually: This instance is deployed to FIWARE testbed and can be accessed without any credentials.

tile-places-hamburg.description: This is one tile (containing the "Places" in Hamburg, Germany) provided by the 3D-Map Tiles SE using the Overpass API backend.
tile-places-hamburg.title: Single tile

oulu.description: Small part of Oulu (Finland) using the GIS-DP GE for aerial imaging and building footprints.
oulu.title: Oulu

documentation.why-you-need-it: When moving from traditional 2D-map applications towards geo-referenced interactive 3D-applications, a representation of the environmental ground (i.e. terrain) is needed. The 3D-Map Tiles SE addresses this requirement in a flexible approach and easy-to-use way for web-based application. It seamlessly incorporates with the 3D-UI GE from FI-WARE and thereby preserves full control over rendering to the client application.
documentation.how-it-works: The 3D-Map Tiles SE queries one of its backends for the given bounds of the requested map tile, retrieves and processes the data from the query result, and finally delivers the map tile as XML3D resource to the client application. Optionally, the resulting XML3D resource will be cached.
documentation.what-it-does: The 3D-Map Tiles SE supplies in an OpenStreetMap-like manner map tiles of the ground. These tiles are a 3D representation of the scene ground in contrast to usual image tiles of OSM. Moreover, the 3D-Map Tiles SE supports different backend data providers to offer different kinds of tiles, such as projected OSM-tiles and laser-scanned elevation data with textures. Therefore, the 3D-Map Tiles SE incorporates the GIS-DP GE from FIWARE.

company.fullname: German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence
